q: of staff under President Lyndon Johnson Gerald Ford - with passages initialed by Donald Rumsfeld 's then-assistant, Dick Cheney . "It's not a journal, it's not a diary," he says of the Gerald Ford White House notes. It is a set of working documents that I've never edited. In fact, most I've never reread. As defense secretary under President Bush , Donald Rumsfeld issued thousands of memos, "snowflakes," they were called. He reads from some issued in 2003 and in 2005: "Are we winning or losing the

do his job and was starting to prove a distraction for the Government." Mr David Cameron made clear he had "full confidence" in Mr Andy Coulson and had not pushed him out. He said: During his time working for me, Andy Coulson has carried out his role with complete professionalism. He has been a brilliant member of my team and has thrown himself at the job with skill and dedication. Scotland Yard inquiry into phone hacking ended with the 2007 conviction and jailing of Glenn Mulcaire , a private investigator working for the paper. Mr Andy Coulson later resigned and six months later was appointed as Director of Communications

2009. When office romances go bad, however, it can cause difficulties for everyone involved. Some casualties include David Letterman and assistant Stephanie Birkitt , Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck , and Jennifer Aniston and funnyman Vince Vaughn . When co-workers become romantically-involved, they often aren't thinking about what's going to happen next week, let alone next year, says Tony Lee, publisher of CareerCast.com. ... It just[ felt] negative." The "Just Go With It' star was referring to past seasons that included the outspoken Simon Cowell at the judges' table. Oprah Winfrey defended him, saying, I'm a Simon Cowell fan and what I thought is that Simon Cowell had a way of speaking the truth that was saying what you wanted to say but you wouldn't actually say it. She added, "I will say that it"s a kinder, gentler[ show now.]"

Report Abuse I sincerely hope the Egyptian people eventually will win their freedom. However, the Cairo museum is one of the world's greatest museums. It's artifacts are beyond price. They are the cultural heritage of the Egyptian people representing one of the world's earliest and greatest civilizations. It would be a tragedy for Egypt and it's people if the Cairo Museum were looted and trashed like the Bagdad Museum. Report Abuse "Headline: "Egypt's museums and monuments are deserted""

We seriously considered it, which for a small town boy from Southern Indiana is a very humbling thing..., Mike Pence said last week. "But at the end of the day, we ultimately believed that where our little family is led is somewhere in the service of the people of Indiana in the days ahead."
